item.title: I think my complier is giving me random errors?
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

Jeremy368:

LOL thats all i did wrong??

little stuff like that is what you have to pay the highest attention too. If you are in doubt always end your lines with a ; pretty much all coding lines end with ) or ;

Read full topic
item.source: I think my complier is giving me random errors?

item.title: I think my complier is giving me random errors?
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:9, topic:251420”][quote author=masta XY link=topic=331858.msg2590289#msg2590289 date=1229731005]

Look at what you recently changed or added, if it is not inside brackets, or if there is an extra bracket, delete it.

You do not need a ; after everything, because that will bring more errors.

You are simply having an error because of a bracket.

Actually that is suppose to have a ; to end it.
[/quote]

its the start of the method…if you are talking about this:

public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot); {

You wouldn’t put a ; before the opening bracket of a method.[/quote]
that is a one line statement calling on a void set to show dropped items.

Read full topic
item.source: I think my complier is giving me random errors?

item.title: I think my complier is giving me random errors?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“masta XY, post:8, topic:251420”][quote author=chassy13 link=topic=331858.msg2590284#msg2590284 date=1229730872]
Look at what you recently changed or added, if it is not inside brackets, or if there is an extra bracket, delete it.

You do not need a ; after everything, because that will bring more errors.

You are simply having an error because of a bracket.
[/quote]

Actually that is suppose to have a ; to end it.[/quote]

its the start of the method…if you are talking about this:

public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot); {

You wouldn’t put a ; before the opening bracket of a method.

Read full topic

item.source: I think my complier is giving me random errors?

item.title: I think my complier is giving me random errors?
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

I have been having some problems doing simple things like adding NPCs and Making safe areas. I know how to do both of these but for some reason something messes up. Once all of my npcs just disappeared i could spawn i could even take my Autospawn.cfg stick it in another source and it work perfectly. I some how worked past that and now i am have this random error problem this is the 2nd random error i have had. now i am not sure if its random or not but considering both times i have gotten the error they are 2 completely different errors and the code the errors were saying had errors in it have not been edited in a long long time nor did i see and errors in the code.

So here is my Latest random error

client.java:13518: illegal start of expression public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13518: ';' expected public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13518: <identifier> expected public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13518: not a statement public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13518: ';' expected public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13518: ';' expected public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13610: illegal start of expression public int getXPForLevel(int level) { ^ client.java:13610: ';' expected public int getXPForLevel(int level) { ^ client.java:13610: ';' expected public int getXPForLevel(int level) { ^ client.java:13625: illegal start of expression public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { ^ client.java:13625: ';' expected public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { ^ client.java:13625: ';' expected public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { ^ client.java:13640: illegal start of expression public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ^ client.java:13640: ';' expected public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ^ client.java:13640: <identifier> expected public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ^ client.java:13640: not a statement public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ^ client.java:13640: ';' expected public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ^ client.java:13812: illegal start of expression public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13812: ';' expected public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13812: <identifier> expected public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13812: not a statement public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ client.java:13812: ';' expected public If you need the code mentioned in the error let me know.
